meanings.definition: A sudden, sharp noise or sound.
meanings.sent1: The glutch of thunder startled the children.
meanings.sent2: I heard a glutch coming from the old house.
meanings.sent3: The glutch of the door slamming made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The glutch of the car brakes screeching echoed through the street.
meanings.sent5: The glutch of the balloon popping made everyone cover their ears.

meanings.definition: To make a sudden, sharp noise.
meanings.sent1: She accidentally glutched the glass, causing it to break.
meanings.sent2: The branches glutch against the window in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The cat likes to glutch the toy mouse around the room.
meanings.sent4: The fireworks glutched loudly in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: He tried to quietly open the door, but it still glutched.

meanings.sent1: The kitchen was in a glutch after the cooking experiment.
meanings.sent2: She tried to clean up the glutch of papers on her desk.
meanings.sent3: The glutch of toys on the floor made it hard to walk.
meanings.sent4: The glutch of wires behind the TV needed organizing.
meanings.sent5: The glutch of traffic during rush hour was frustrating.

meanings.definition: To make a mess or cause confusion.
meanings.sent1: He managed to glutch up the entire room in minutes.
meanings.sent2: The kids always find a way to glutch up their play area.
meanings.sent3: She tends to glutch things when she's in a hurry.
meanings.sent4: The wind can glutch up the neatly raked leaves in seconds.
meanings.sent5: Try not to glutch the order of the files when organizing them.
